message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.SI 

The paper proposes a novel semi-supervised clustering algorithm based on the information-maximization principle. This algorithm is an extension of a previous unsupervised information-maximization clustering algorithm based on squared-loss mutual information to effectively incorporate must-links and cannot-links. The paper also discusses the computational efficiency of the proposed method and its ability to systematically optimize tuning parameters. Based on this, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the application of the proposed method in computer vision (cs.CV) and social networks (cs.SI), making these two sub-categories less likely but still possible.
